snippet: In one of the most stunning primary election upsets in congressional history, Mr. Cantor, the House majority leader, was soundly defeated by David Brat, a Tea Party-backed candidate.
abstract: Republican Rep Eric Cantor, House majority leader, is soundly defeated by David Brat, Tea Party-backed economics professor in Virginia primary; it is one of the most stunning primary election upsets in congressional history; Brat toppled Cantor with a campaign budget of just over $200,000, repeatedly criticizing him for being insufficiently conservative, particularly on immigration.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jackie Calmes, Jeremy W. Peters, Jennifer Steinhauer and Jonathan Weisman.

lead_paragraph: In one of the most stunning primary election upsets in congressional history, Mr. Cantor, the House majority leader, was soundly defeated by David Brat, a Tea Party-backed candidate.

headline.sub: Cantor Suffers Stunning Loss in Virginia Primary
headline.main: Eric Cantor Defeated by David Brat, Tea Party Challenger, in G.O.P. Primary Upset
headline.print_headline: House Majority Leader Upset by Tea Party Rival in Primary
